intro: Subrisia petiolaris, commonly known as the slender petioled spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
